alert.note: Non-Weather Emergency Message. Not sent to IPAWS.

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 29 at 11:30AM PDT by NWS Portland OR
info.description:
The Lane Regional Air Protection Agency has issued an Air Quality Advisory for western Lane County, which is IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT TUESDAY. Periods of intermittent smoke are expected in eastern Lane County, including Eugene-Springfield.
An Air Quality Advisory for Smoke has been issued. Wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted conditions will cause air quality to reach unhealthy levels at times through Tuesday evening.
Pollutants in smoke can cause burning eyes, runny nose, aggravate heart and lung diseases, and aggravate other serious health problems. Limit outdoor activities and keep children indoors if it is smoky. Please follow medical advice if you have a heart or lung condition.
More information about air quality can be found at: www.oregon.gov/DEQ www.lrapa.org

parameter.value: AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR WESTERN LANE COUNTY UNTIL 8 PM PDT TUESDAY
